On Thu, 9 Sep 2004 11:54:14 -0700 (PDT), Bharath Khambadkone
<bkhambadkone@...> wrote:
> I'm very new at this, Another team at my work place has been using this Httpunit/junit for
testing their app. Our management decided to use the same framework
they had and when i was trying to create xml flows i was not able to
get past these pages as junit/http unit could not set focus on the pop
up windows and when i contacted the other team they told me that
functionality had not ben built into the framework. So i was not sure
if we could handle pop up windows and page refreshed. I would really
appreciate if you could let me know how its done. And thanks for your
quick response.

As the author of HttpUnit, I can assure you that such functionality is
most definitely built in. (I cannot believe that I forgot to include
this in the FAQ). Now there are a number of different types of
"pop-up" windows. New windows launched by settting targets to _blank
or an unknown frame name are created as new instances of WebWindow.
You can check for their creation by setting a WebWindowListener.

The other types are triggered by JavaScript. Alert dialog require no
user interaction (other than to dismiss them) and their content can be
read by the WebClient: popNextAlert and getNextAlert methods.
JavaScript dialogs can be checked and answered by adding a
DialogResponder.

Examples of all of these are found in the regression tests included in
the archive. I will make sure to add them to the FAQ.
